{"step_by_step_thinking": "The split finger technique is a surgical procedure used in dentistry. It is not used for gingival augmentation, which involves increasing the amount of gum tissue. It is also not used for sinus augmentation procedures, which involve increasing the amount of bone in the upper jaw. The split finger technique is not used for the first stage of implant surgery, which involves placing the implant into the jawbone. However, it is used for the creation of inter-implant papillae, which are the triangular bits of gum between teeth or implants.", "answer_choice": "D"}
